Articles.Content:
Hey there,

I hope there is no other thread like this, at least I have not found anything similar. In this thread, I'd like to collect a couple of things you can do in KSP's Sandbox mode because I've gotten pretty bored lately and thought it would also be helpful for other people to have this.

I've got a table which contains a stock and a modded section, of course, if you are only using mods like MechJeb or EVE, it is still stock, but for example "map Kerbin's surface with ScanSAT" would go to the modded section. Please submit your ideas under here, and I'll keep this updated. If you have any suggestions, please feel free to tell me.

I'll begin with a couple of basic things and will add my own ideas if I get new ones. If anyone has got examples for different things to do, please post a link under here and I will attach it to the table. I hope it helps.

Last updated: 28.08.14

[TABLE=class: grid, width: 1000, align: center]

<tbody>[TR]

[TD=align: center]Stock[/TD]

[TD=align: center]Modded[/TD]

[TD=align: center]Special [/TD]

[TD=align: center]Little stuff[/TD]

[/TR]

[TR]

[TD=align: center]Explore Kerbin.

Fly to the poles with a plain, search for anomalies and easter eggs, or just drive around with a rover. Build a base or just fly around with a plane. You can use the mod Kerbin-Side to launch from other locations, for example.[/TD]

[TD=align: center][ScanSAT]

Map the surfaces of planets.

ScanSAT's mapping sensors can give you nice maps of planets for example to help with finding landing sites. It has 4 different sensors and each has it's own function. For example, some sensors can mark anomalies on a map and some else show you the slopes of a planet. It's a great mod and I recommend checking it out![/TD]

[TD=align: center]Land / takeoff from every planet.

Although this is more a challenge than a task to do, this may be quite an achievement to have landed and taken off from every planet. Maybe you can also plant a flag on every planet as a bit of an achievement, if you want it to be a bit harder, plant a flag on the poles of every planet. Don't underestimate Eve, Eve has a very thick atmosphere compared to Kerbin and according to the KSP Wiki it takes about 11.500m/s of Ã¢Ë†â€ V to take off from Eve, it's a really hard challenge to takeoff from Eve. If someone managed to do it, please post it here.. I'd be interested in it.[/TD]

[TD=align: center]Ã¢â‚¬â€¹Use different orbits.

KSP players usually use equatorial or polar orbits. Use something else! Make your orbit special, or make a sculpture or something else out of orbits! [/TD]

[/TR]

[TR]

[TD=align: center]Build a station.

Build a space station. The first station you build should usually be in an orbit around Kerbin, but it's up to you where you place it. Stations can have different purposes, like refueling ships that fly to interplanetary missions or doing science in orbit, but that's not really necessary in sandbox mode. You can also use it as a crew habitat or build a replica of the ISS. Usually, stations consist of a core module, a habitat module, and a fuel module. Feel free to add other modules like escape pods or even docking drones![/TD]

[TD=align: center][Karbonite / Kethane]

Build a mining base / refueling outpost.

Karbonite and Kethane add resources to KSP which enable you to mine them and convert them into fuel or use them to generate electricity. Using this advantage, you can build a mining base / refueling outpost for the resource and use it to refuel your ships. One important thing to mention is that to find Kethane you first need to scan a planet / moon for it and the resource concentration is like "all or nothing". Karbonite uses different concentrations instead of it which means you can find it nearly everywhere but there are hotspots where the concentration is really high.[/TD]

[TD=align: center]Make a space tourism program.

Do you know Virgin Galactic? It's a british spaceflight company which offers suborbital spaceflights for anybody who is able to do it (the launch "produces" quite a lot of G-Force, which is why not everyone is able to do it) and has got enough money. VG and also other spaceflight companies plan to make a "hotel" in space - a space station around Earth, with quite a lot of wellness and fitness stuff. Maybe you can do that for you Kerbals too? Make a space tourism program where you offer sub-orbital flights or even build a "hotel" on other planets or a station! SSTO's are a clever choice for making this.[/TD]

[TD=align: center]Do stunts.

Build a nice-looking jet to fly around at KSC and do stunts like close fly-bys at the VAB just to see it explode afterwards - expect Jeb is flying. You could also make an orbit right through a canyon which would be pretty nice to think of.. Imagine having a station flying through a canyon on mun.. Or build a rover equipped with a SAS module to do stunts in mid-air on low-grav surfaces.[/TD]

[/TR]

[TR]

[TD=align: center]Explore Kerbin's System.

Kerbin's system consists of Kerbin itself and two small moons which are orbiting around Kerbin, Mun and Minmus. Explore them. Land on them, plant a flag there and fly back home or even build a base on a planet of those. You can also land a rover on them and drive around with it. It's a lot of fun, but pay attention to the terrain and don't forget to quicksave![/TD]

[TD=align: center][RemoteTech 2]

Build a satellite network.

RemoteTech 2 brings new difficulties to the game. With RemoteTech 2, unmanned vessels need to be connected to the KSC with the help of other satellites. By putting satellites in a geostationary orbit around Kerbin you ensure they have connection to the KSC and you got the ability to steer the vessel. You can also configurate RT2 so that you will have a delay depending on the distance between vessel and KSC.[/TD]

[TD=align: center]Launch a space station and de-orbit it.

Sounds silly, doesn't it? Well, actually it's pretty fun. Assemble a space station in orbit, make asure you've got a lot of modules docked together. Evacuate all Kerbals or put them into escape pods, then use an engine to de-orbit it and watch it during reentry.. Prepare for structural failures, or just dock off some stuff in mid-flight and there you go - DESTRUCTION! Jeb approved. [/TD]

[TD=align: center]Use Gravity Assists.

Although this is not a lot more effective, it's nice to see your ship using <enter planet="" here="">'s SOI to swing into another. Here is a nice tutorial on how to do a gravity assist in the KSP wiki. Maybe the fly-by even satisfies you and motivates you to land on the planet you've just flown past.

</enter>[/TD]

[/TR]

[TR]

[TD=align: center]Do a challenge.

There are plenty of challenges in this subforum, if you are bored and think you can do one, search for one that interests you and do it. Maybe you can get into the Top 3 or better? Have fun with it![/TD]

[TD=align: center][PlanetFactory]

Explore new solar systems.

PlanetFactory gives you the ability to explore new solar systems like this or even create your own ones. In the basic mod three sample systems are already included, so have fun exploring them.[/TD]

[TD=align: center]Optimize your lifters or build new one.

Build your own lifter family. A good example is the Lopac Lifter Family. Try to build something similar to it and optimize your lifters, for example build a recoverable launch stage or SSTO's for full recoverability! Got an efficient lifter? Try to lift more? The NRAP mod is great for construction of lifters.[/TD]

[TD=align: center]Fly a stock craft.

Tired of building your own rockets just to see them explode and your Kerbals getting killed? Me too. (But I accidentally deleted the stock rockets..) Just pick some of the good-locking stock rockets / planes, for example the Kerbal X, and take it for a ride to Mun.[/TD]

[/TR]

[TR]

[TD=align: center]Explore the System.

The system of Kerbol (the sun of the solar system) is pretty big and offers a wide variety of planets to explore. Laythe for example is a nice places to visit as it offer oxygen which gives you the ability to fly there with jet engines.[/TD]

[TD=align: center][Part Mods]

Build a vessel with only mod parts.

May not be a hard challenge, but something good to kill the time. Try to build a rocket / plane using only mod parts or as little stock parts as possible. It gives your vessel a lot of new things to discover. Have fun with it![/TD]

[TD=align: center]Develop a Kraken Drive for 0.24.

"Kraken Drive? What's that?", you may ask. And here is your answer. It seems like the "bug" making the creation of this was more and more fixed, but maybe it is still possible to build a kraken drive in 0.24. Or not? You can find it out. Maybe you should watch tutorials on these in old versions.[/TD]

[TD=align: center][/TD]

[/TR]

[TR]

[TD=align: center]Build bases on other planets.

Building bases on other planets can help you service your landing and launching rockets / spaceplanes with fuel. You may consider using Kerbal Attachment System, it's a mod that adds new parts which make it easier to connect parts together, it allows you to pull stuff or even hang on cliffs. [/TD]

[TD=align: center][Extraplanetary Launchpads]

Build rockets from other.. place.

EPL (Extraplanetary Launchpads) allows you to build rockets / spaceplanes everywhere as long as you've got the needed resources for it. You need to fuel it and supply your EPL "Hangar", or better launchpad with the resources. You can build a ship everywhere where you can supply your base / station and have got the needed things required for a launchpad "base" to work. Have fun![/TD]

[TD=align: center]Make a mod.

The most people on the KSP forum usually watch for new mods in the Add-on releases sub-forum, because mods are really wanted in KSP. Some add new parts or even new planets, other mods are just there for enhancing the graphics and some change the contracts you get. If you CAN code a mod and have got a good idea for it, then make one. A lot of people will be interested if your mod is going to be good and offers something new and interesting.[/TD]

[TD=align: center][/TD]

[/TR]

[TR]

[TD=align: center]Do an ARM.

ARM stands for Asteroid Redirect Mission. You need to build a rocket which 'docks' with an asteroid with the help of the claw and then redirects it - maybe to Low Kerbin Orbit, maybe on Kerbin's surface. You might want to build an astro-plane.. just like

. Or you could try making an asteroid swim.. But to be honest, I've got no idea how to do that. They are a bit too heavy, or not?[/TD]

[TD=align: center][KSP Interstellar]

Build... crazy stuff.

KSP Interstellar offers a whole lot of new parts and new game mechanics. Build nuclear fuel mines on planets, fuel facilities, antimatter supply lines, microwave beamed power arrays, tritium breeder reactor setups, emulate Robert Zubrin's Mars Direct mission to Duna with the in-situ methane resource system or do an alcubierre-drive powered grand tour of the solar system. Simple, right?[/TD]

[TD=align: center]Hit the sun or escape the system.

As they both require a lot of Ã¢Ë†â€ V (as far as I know) this may also be kind of a hard challenge. Try to fire your rocket out of the system or crash into Kerbol. Pay attention to not bring Jebediah with you, if you're unlucky, Kerbol will explode when it gets in contact with Jeb. Believe me. No, this is not just a placeholder text to fill up that gap down to the margin of the table. Anyways, try to do this. It should be hard, but it will give you some nice screenshots, especially hitting the sun![/TD]

[TD][/TD]

[/TR]

[TR]

[TD=align: center]Be green!

Not really needed in Sandbox but still nice to have: Reduce your fleet to a couple of ships who can do a lot of things like a lifter family or simply an SSTO which brings all the cargo to your station, reuse your rockets / planes *SSTO* and recycle - or better, recover your dropped stages for being green![/TD]

[TD][/TD]

[TD=align: center]Do a grand tour.

Grand tour means to visit every planet in KSP's system in one trip. Maybe you can forget about Eve.. But it would still be a big accomplishment to do so. The rocket used for this usually doesn't visit the KSC during the trip, except maybe a refuel in Kerbin's orbit. Decide for yourself![/TD]

[TD][/TD]

[/TR]

[TR]

[TD=align: center][/TD]

[TD][/TD]

[TD=align: center]Break a speed record.

Ã¢â‚¬â€¹Either land speed or airspeed. I don't know any records yet, I'm sure you will find some people who recorded a record for KSP on YouTube, I'm pretty sure Scott Manleys "Your physics have no power over me" broke already a record, but it was with cheats. So, try to put a new speed record there, either land or air, and post it on the forum. I'm sure other people have already tried the same and will share their results.[/TD]

[TD][/TD]

[/TR]

[TR]

[TD=align: center][/TD]

[TD][/TD]

[TD=align: center]Be in a geostationary orbit of 2 planets at a time ( Duna and Ike ).

I actually have no idea how to do this, but SorryDave said it is possible with those two planets. I bet Scott Manley has already made this, but I haven't found a video of it yet.[/TD]

[TD][/TD]

[/TR]

</tbody>[/TABLE]

got an idea? Post it and I'll add it!

Thanks for reading and/or participating!
